meanings.definition: To treat (soil) with acid to form a podsol.
meanings.sent1: The farmer podsolized the soil to improve its quality.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners often podsolize the land to make it suitable for certain plants.
meanings.sent3: After the acid treatment, the soil felt like it had been podsolized into a new state.
meanings.sent4: The transformation of the earth into a podsol was like magic after being podsolized.
meanings.sent5: The process of podsolizing the soil created a vibrant and fertile environment.

meanings.sent1: Over time, the soil podsolized naturally due to environmental factors.
meanings.sent2: The ground podsolized after years of exposure to acidic conditions.
meanings.sent3: The soil seemed surprised when it suddenly podsolized on its own.
meanings.sent4: The landscape podsolized like a chameleon changing colors.
meanings.sent5: Nature's way of podsolizing the earth was a slow but fascinating process.
